comment: Good Professor! He graded the written assignments easier than I expected him to, which was wonderful because the majority of our overall grade was from written assignments. Although it took a lot of time and diligence, the class was not hard to follow and I never felt lost.

I took him for Intro To Public Administration... not the most fascinating teacher, but he's good. He teaches and tests fairly. Also, he's the chair of the Political Science Department--and he's a fair man who listens and will help solve problems with other PolySci professors. He's a good man and well deserves his position.
He really wants everyone to understand the material and I love him as a person. Very easy, despite that it's an honor's class. lectures well and assignments vary. Take him!

Dr. Smith is an awesome professor, some of his assigments may seem intimidating but it's easy to make good grades if you turn in decent work. The workload was light and his notes were very clear. I highly reccomend his class and would gladly take it again although I have no interest in the subject.

Dr. Smith is very knowledgable about the subject matter, but tends to go off topic frequently, and at times it is hard to understand the point he is trying to make. Just show up to class and turn in the assignments and you should make a decent grade.

Dr. Smith has a lot of information and knows what he is talking about, but is not the best at conveying the information clearly. He has 8 reading set assignments, that are easy A's, 5 group projects (easy A's) and 1 final exam Overall the class was informative, but hard to keep up with the information.
